item.title: The sweet scientific vindication of ‘I told you so’
item.description: A new books tells the stories of scientists ‘ridiculed, exiled, and Imprisoned for being right.’

item.title: I am a Catholic. And a Zionist.
item.description: Carrie Prejean Boller and Candace Owens are wrong. Catholics can be Zionists.

item.title: European-scale taxation, New York-scale dysfunction

item.description: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor’s arrest marks an irrevocable downturn in the royal family’s stature.

item.description: Recent glimpses of exotic directed-energy weapons raise a question: How will they change warfare?

item.description: Investors and consumers both lose when politics infect dealmaking.

item.description: New START couldn’t protect America — and the president knew it.

item.title: Incredibly, men are still wearing ‘the George Washington’
item.description: The nation’s first president paved the way for the navy blazer and khaki pants.

item.description: At HUD, we’re seeking changes to make sure federally funded housing goes to its intended recipients.

item.description: The civil rights icon was an agent for chaos and change.

item.description: Thrive Living’s partnership with Costco is the exception that proves the rule about what’s broken in housing.

item.title: Mamdani’s ‘painful’ tax admission

item.title: Why the EPA’s emissions reversal is the responsible decision
item.description: The climate challenge is more nuanced and manageable than the agency once assumed.

item.title: This Olympic ritual offers a lesson about money
item.description: Olympians bite their medals to test their purity. It used to be the same with currency.

item.title: The 2020 ‘stolen election’ obsession: Cynical? Delusional? Reptilian?
item.description: Trump believes his losing at anything is impossible. Thus, Biden’s win must be fraudulent.
